item.title: JEval for JMeter
item.description:
JEval helps you to evaluate your JMeter test plan and provides recommendation before you start your performance testing.

It is a linter for JMeter.

item.title: PerfAction JMeter
item.description: This GitHub Action helps to automate performance testing using Apache JMeter and its plugins.

item.title: LoadRunner Exercises
item.description: These exercises were designed to learn LoadRunner by doing. This exercise series is a part of Performance Testing Trilogy üî∫.

item.title: Linux Docker LoadRunnerDeveloper
item.description: This docker image helps you to run LoadRunner Developer scripts in Linux container. LoadRunner Developer leverages DevWeb protocol, a brand new offering from Micro Focus.

item.title: Windows Docker WebTours
item.description: This docker file helps you to run Web Tours application in Windows container. Web Tours is the sample application to learn Micro Focus LoadRunner Professional.

item.title: Docker Netling
item.description:
üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è What is Netling?

Netling is a load tester client for easy web testing. It is extremely fast while using little CPU or memory. It is an open source project. Developed by Tore Lervik.

item.title: JMeter Streamlit
item.description: Apache JMeter is an open source load testing tool written in 100% pure Java. JMeter supports umpteen protocols including HTTP(S), FTP, SMTP, Web Services, JMS and much more. In JMeter, you can generate HTML results after you done with the execution or you can use Backend Listeners to monitor the runtime results.

item.title: Windows Docker JMeter Plugins
item.description: This repo helps you to run Apache JMeter in your Windows container. It uses the JMeter on Windows Server Core with OpenJDK. Windows Docker Container for Apache JMeter and Plugins

item.title: Docker JMeter Windows
item.description: This repo helps you to run Apache JMeter in your Windows container. It uses the JMeter on Windows Server Core with OpenJDK. Windows Docker for Apache JMeter

item.title: Windows Docker LoadRunner Developer
item.description: This docker image helps you to run LoadRunner Developer scripts in Windows container. LoadRunner Developer leverages DevWeb protocol, a brand new offering from Micro Focus.

item.title: Hello Performance
item.description: Hello, Performance! This website will list all my open source contributions. Thanks for stopping by.

item.title: Warsaw, Poland
item.description: Palace of Culture and Science (Polish: Pa≈Çac Kultury i Nauki), is a notable high-rise building in central Warsaw, Poland. With a total height of 237 metres (778 ft) it is the tallest building in Poland, the 5th-tallest building in the European Union (including spire) and one of the tallest on the European continent. Constructed in 1955, it houses various public and cultural institutions such as cinemas, theatres, libraries, sports clubs, university faculties and authorities of the Polish Academy of Sciences.

item.title: Hel, Poland
item.description: Hel Peninsula (Polish: Mierzeja Helska) is a 35-km-long sand bar peninsula in northern Poland separating the Bay of Puck from the open Baltic Sea. The width of the peninsula varies from approximately 300 m near Jurata, through 100 m in the most narrow part to over 3 km at the tip. Since the peninsula was formed entirely of sand, it is frequently turned into an island by winter storms. Until the 17th century the peninsula was a chain of islands that formed a strip of land only during the summer.

item.title: Hel, Poland
item.description: Hel Peninsula (Polish: Mierzeja Helska) is a 35-km-long sand bar peninsula in northern Poland separating the Bay of Puck from the open Baltic Sea. The width of the peninsula varies from approximately 300 m near Jurata, through 100 m in the most narrow part to over 3 km at the tip. Since the peninsula was formed entirely of sand, it is frequently turned into an island by winter storms. Until the 17th century the peninsula was a chain of islands that formed a strip of land only during the summer.

item.title: Arizona, US
item.description: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, United States. The canyon is 277 miles (446 km) long, up to 18 miles (29 km) wide and attains a depth of over a mile (6,093 feet or 1,857 meters).

item.title: Chicago, US
item.description: Chicago, officially the City of Chicago, is the most populous city in the U.S. state of Illinois, and the third-most-populous city in the United States. With an estimated population of 2,705,994 (2018), it is also the most populous city in the Midwestern United States. Chicago is the county seat of Cook County, the second-most-populous county in the US, with a small portion of the northwest side of the city extending into DuPage County near O’Hare Airport.

item.title: Panaji, India
item.description: Panaji, formerly Panjim, is the capital of the Indian state of Goa and the headquarters of North Goa district. It lies on the banks of the Mandovi River estuary in the Ilhas de Goa sub-district (taluka). With a population of 114,759 in the metropolitan area, Panjim is Goa’s largest urban agglomeration, ahead of Marg√£o and Vasco da Gama.
